p: Alkaloids are an enormous group of phytochemicals of ecological importance, and possess a number of toxicological, pharmacological, nutritional, and cosmetic activities. Alkaloids are extremely abundant in flowering plants (Angiospermae), with a wide distribution in all organs such as leaves, flowers, seeds, roots, stems, fruits, bark, and bulbs. However, the presence and the distribution of these metabolites depend on the phase of plant life cycle, and strongly vary according to plant species, which produce different types of alkaloids, accumulated in various organs [ 163, 164].
